Detailed Description

class for finding the valid token pairs (those that make sense) - handles all the verification of defined conditions

Member Function Documentation

bool Tester::check ( const Token &  t1,
const Token &  t2,
bool &  forbiddenFound 
) const

checks whether t1 and t2 can form a valid pair (meeting the conditions for this couple of parts of speech)

Parameters:
forbiddenFound filled by the function, if true then a forbidden relation was found between t1 and t2
Returns:
true if t1 and t2 match any of the defined conditions
Checks whether there is a condition satisfied by tokens t1,t2
Parameters:
t1 first token
t2 second token
forbiddenFound if a forbidden relation is found, true is stored here and sentence will be declared not making sense
Returns:
true if t1 and t2 meet anz defined condition

const Token &  t2,
const Token &  conj,
bool &  forbiddenFound 
) const

checks whether tokens t1 and t2 can be connected by conj based on defined ConjunctionConditions

Parameters:
forbiddenFound filled by the function, if true then a forbidden relation was found between t1 and t2
Returns:
true if t1 and t2 can be connected by conj based on defined COnjunctionConditions
checks the conjunction conditions available for tokens t1,t2 and conjunction conj, if any of them is met, returns true, otherwise false
Parameters:

t2 second token

bool Tester::getMaxCondition ( Tester::posCouple  c,
int &  max 
) const

checks whether there is a max number of relations conditions available for a part-of-speech couple c (not symetric!), if it is, returns true and stores the maximum number in max, otherwise returns false and leaves max undefined
